SEARCH
Package it.polimi.ingsw.model

Class BookShelf

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.BookShelf
All Implemented Interfaces:
OnUpdateNeededListener, Serializable
public class BookShelf extends Object implements Serializable, OnUpdateNeededListener

Class used to represent bookshelf for each player.

This class is unique per Player entity.

Standard bookshelf dimension are:

  • 6: for rows
  • 5: for columns
According to the Rulebook.

To declare a BookShelf with other dimension use BookShelf(int row, int column) constructor.

Common goal and personal goal are assigned based on bookshelf field of this class

Since:
26/04/2023
Version:
5.0
Author:
Tommaso Trabacchin, Melanie Tonarelli, Emanuele Valsecchi, Adem Shehi

      private TileSubject[][] tileSubjectTaken
      Matrix used to represent the BookShelf for each Player. This field will contain tile objects to show not only the type of card taken from the Board but also a specific image.

    • isFull

      public boolean isFull()
      This method goes through each position of tileSubjectTaken and determinate if it is full or not
      Returns:
      true if the BookShelf matrix is full, false otherwise

    • getTypeCell

      private TileType getTypeCell(int row, int column)
      This method returns TileType contained at position row and column specified as parameter.
      Parameters:
      row - the row index in bookshelf matrix to which retrieve the TileType
      column - the column index in bookshelf matrix to which retrieve the TileType
      Returns:
      TileType of TileSubject stored at the position referred at the parameter passed, null if the cells doesn't contain an element
      See Also:
      • BookShelf
      • TileType

    • toTileTypeMatrix

      public TileType[][] toTileTypeMatrix()
      This method convert the tileSubjectTaken field from TileSubject matrix to TileType matrix
      Returns:
      matrix of TileType according to the TileSubject entry inside tileSubjectTaken
      See Also:
      • BookShelf
      • tileSubjectTaken

    • addTileSubjectTaken

      public void addTileSubjectTaken(List<TileSubject> taken, int column)
      This method is used to put the TileSubject taken from the Board inside the BookShelf.
      Parameters:
      taken - is a List of TileSubject that contains the tiles dragged from the board
      column - is the column of bookshelf in which insert the tile's taken
      Throws:
      ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if column parameter is negative or exceed the maximum column dimension
      NoTileTakenException - if the parameter taken is null or its size is 0
      NotEnoughSpaceInBookShelfException - if BookShelf is full and can't contain all element passed as parameter
      NotEnoughSpaceInBookShelfException - if the number of cells empty in the column is not enough to hold all tiles object passed as parameter
      See Also:
      • BookShelf
      • isFull()
      • Board
      • NotEnoughSpaceInBookShelfException
      • NoTileTakenException

    • getFirstEmptyRowFromBottom

      private int getFirstEmptyRowFromBottom(int column)

      Retrieve the first "row cell" in column inside the bookshelf matrix that is empty.

      The row is chosen starting from the bottom of the matrix. The column is set by the parameter.

      Parameters:
      column - the column in which the tiles must be inserted
      Returns:
      number between 0 and row dimension representing first cell in BookShelf matrix that is empty.
      In case that the column is full -1 is returned.
      See Also:
      • BookShelf
      • TileSubject
